desc1.pins2: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc2.pins2: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc3.pins2: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc4.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

desc7.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc8.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc9.pins2: RXD0 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 0

desc10.pins2: TXD0 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 0

desc11.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc11.pins3: RXD1 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 1

desc12.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc12.pins3: TXD1 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 1

desc13.pins2: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc14.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc15.pins2: ICP1 - Timer/Counter1 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter1 description for further details.
desc15.pins3: OC2B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC2B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc16.pins2: OC2A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC2A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc19.pins2: SCL - 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.

desc20.pins2: SDA - 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.

desc21.pins2: TCK - JTAG - Test Clock. JTAG operation is synchronous to TCK.

desc22.pins2: TMS - JTAG - Test Mode Select. This pin is used for navigating through the TAP-controller.

desc23.pins2: TDO - JTAG - Test Data Out. Serial output data from Instruction register or Data Register.

desc24.pins2: TDI - JTAG - Test Data In. Serial input data to be shifted in to the Instruction Register or Data Register (Scan Chains).

desc25.pins2: TOSC1 - Timer Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc26.pins2: TOSC2 - Timer Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1. See CONFIG CLOCK for usage as internal clock.

desc27.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.

desc29.pins1: AREF - Reference voltage for AD converter.

desc40.pins3: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc41.pins2: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc42.pins2: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.
desc42.pins3: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc43.pins2: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.
desc43.pins3: OC0A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc44.pins2: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.
desc44.pins3: OC0B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
